channel.title: Interface Class?
channel.description:
OK, so you know how the Items are loaded through class8, what would be the equivalent for Interfaces, or objects or Npcs? I want to know so that I can dump all the Interface data, like the parent Ids, child IDs, and the default text on the interface.
The attachments below follow the same sort of Idea I want to do with the Interfaces.

item.title: Interface Class?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

OK, I think I’m understanding how the interface class is working. Thanks ^_^.

Ok, So i’ve got the Default Option(The white text in the top left corner of the screen) the Parent ID, the Child ID, and the Frame Text. What other info should I find?

Read full topic

item.title: Interface Class?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

zyle1992:

Ok, thanks. Just a quick question, is 18100 what you set the interface ID of the items kept on death interface?

Yep.

Read full topic

item.title: Interface Class?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Yep.
I’ll just copy all i have, then you can just take a look at it all.

This is the whole of my method204. Excluding a huge interface at the bottom, it exceeds the 20,000 character post count.

    public void method204(int i, byte byte0, int j)
    {
        int k = anIntArray253[i];
        anIntArray253[i] = anIntArray253[j];
        if(byte0 == 9)
        {
            byte0 = 0;
        } else
        {
            anInt229 = -76;
        }
        anIntArray253[j] = k;
        k = anIntArray252[i];
        anIntArray252[i] = anIntArray252[j];
        anIntArray252[j] = k;
    }

    public static Class9 addTab(int id)
	{
    	Class9 Tab = aClass9Array210[id] = new Class9();

        Tab.anInt236 = id;//236
        Tab.anInt262 = 0;//262
        Tab.anInt217 = 0;//217
        Tab.anInt214 = 0;
        Tab.anInt220 = 512;//220
        Tab.anInt267 = 334;//anint267
        Tab.aByte254 = (byte)0;
        Tab.anInt230 = 0;
        return Tab;
	}

    }
public static void addCloseButton(int i)

        Close.aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1_260 = loadAscheriitSprite(1, "death");
     Close.aString221 = "Close Window";
    }
public static void addDSprite(int i, int j, int k)
    {
        Class9 dSprite = aClass9Array210[i] = new Class9();
        dSprite.anInt250 = i;

        dSprite.aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1_260 = loadAscheriitSprite(k, "death");
    }
private static Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1 loadAscheriitSprite(int i, String s)
{
long l = (Class50.method585((byte)1, s) << 8) + (long)i;
Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1 class30_sub2_sub1_sub1 = (Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1)aClass12_238.method222(l);
if(class30_sub2_sub1_sub1 != null) {
return class30_sub2_sub1_sub1;
}
try {
 class30_sub2_sub1_sub1 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1((new StringBuilder()).append("./Sprites/Interfaces/Items On Death/").append(s).append(" ").append(i).append(".png").toString());
aClass12_238.method223(class30_sub2_sub1_sub1, l, (byte)2);
} catch(Exception exception) {
return null;
}
return class30_sub2_sub1_sub1;
}

    private static Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1 CustomSpriteLoader(int i, String s) 
{
long l = (Class50.method585((byte)1, s) << 8) + (long)i;
Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1 class30_sub2_sub1_sub1 = (Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1)aClass12_238.method222(l);
if(class30_sub2_sub1_sub1 != null) {
return class30_sub2_sub1_sub1;
}
try {
class30_sub2_sub1_sub1 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1("./Sprites/Interfaces/Custom/"+s+" "+i+".png");
aClass12_238.method223(class30_sub2_sub1_sub1, l, (byte)2);
} catch(Exception exception) {
return null;
}
return class30_sub2_sub1_sub1;
}

        class9.aString221 = s;
    }

		Tab.anInt219 = 0;
		Tab.anInt216 = 0;
		Tab.anInt239 = 0;	
	}

}
